info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern New Haven, southern Middlesex, and southwestern New London Counties through 515 PM... At 429 PM, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Guilford, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Clinton, Killingworth and North Madison around 440 PM. Westbrook around 450 PM. Old Saybrook around 455 PM. Chester and Old Lyme around 500 PM. North Lyme around 505 PM. Lyme around 510 PM. Salem and East Lyme around 515 PM. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM for southern Connecticut.
